GoalDesc: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources for sustainable development
TargetDesc: By 2020, conserve at least 10 per cent of coastal and marine areas, consistent with national and international law and based on the best available scientific information
IndicatorDesc: Coverage of protected areas in relation to marine areas
SeriesDesc: Protected marine area (Exclusive Economic Zones) (square kilometres)
Source: Protected Planet: The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) [On-line], January, 2018, International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) and United Nations Environment Programme's World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC).
Footnotes: The Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) comprises an area which extends either from the coast, or in federal systems from the seaward boundaries of the constituent states (3 to 12 nautical miles, in most cases) to 200 nautical miles (370 kilometres) off the coast.
